sub_title: Professor Organizational learning in the knowledge society at Open University of the Netherlands
summary:
Main research themes (see also www.marjoleincaniels.com):
-	Enhance our understanding of knowledge management within firms. How can knowledgeable people be attracted to the firm and what role can be played by personal development (formal and informal)? In what way can staff training (learning at the individual / employee level) contribute to better social, ecological and economic performance of the firm.
-	Shed light on the issues at play in the management of relations in the supply chain, with a focus on learning from forward and backward linkages. A key objective is improving our insights about the factors that stimulate or hamper interorganizational learning and innovation.
-	Improving our insights about factors that stimulate or hamper learning processes that take place in the interaction between governmental institutes and firms. A central aim is to shed light on the way in which governmental institutions can stimulate learning within firms and regions with the aim of enhancing social, ecological and economic development – i.e., People, Planet, Profit dimensions of sustainable development.

Specialties: Innovation; Organizational learning; Technological progress; Economic growth; Sustainability

ORCHID: http://orcid.org/0000-0002-4206-4083

awards.title: Award
awards.description:
- The paper titled ‘The Antecedents of Creativity Revisited: A Process Perspective’ was awarded for the Best Paper Award 2014 by the CIM journal.

- Best submission to the Research Methods Track of the Eastern Academy of Management, International Conference on Managing in a Global Economy XIV: Global Web of Knowledge, Bangalore, India - June 26-30, 2011.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: - The paper “Explaining the internet usage of SMEs: the impact of market orientation, behavioural norms, motivation and technology acceptance” published in Internet Research 2015 has been selected by the journal’s editorial team as the Outstanding Paper in the 2016 Emerald Literati Network Awards for Excellence.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description:
- The paper titled ‘The Antecedents of Creativity Revisited: A Process Perspective’, was the Most cited Creativity And Innovation Management article published in 2014 & 2015.
- The paper titled ‘Implementing Green Supply Chain Practices: An empirical investigation in the Shipbuilding Industry’ has been judged as amongst the best accepted papers in the programme of the 2015 Academy of Management Meeting (August 7-11, Vancouver, BC, Canada) and is published in the best paper proceedings.

profile_positions.description:
- Managing a research group of about 30 researchers
- Stimulating and facilitating researchers to undertake scientific research in the field of organizational learning
- Supervision of 12 PhD students
- Supervision of various MA and MSc students
- Acquisition of research projects
- Acquisition of education projects
- Expert advisor to the Skane regional government (Sweden) about competitive industrial clusters
- Expert advisor to the Walloon regional government (Belgium) about competitive industrial clusters
- Reviewer for 18 ISI listed academic journals and 3 academic publishers
- Member of ICO, The Interuniversity Centre for Educational Research (In Dutch 'Interuniversitair Centrum voor Onderwijsonderzoek')
- External fellow of ECIS (Eindhoven Center of Innovation Studies)
- Publishing various scientific articles in academic journals and books. For a complete list see: marjoleincaniels.blog.com

profile_positions.description:
Head of scientific research, reporting to the Dean of the faculty of Management Sciences
-	Develop and disseminate criteria for scientific research
-	Develop and carry out scientific research audits of faculty units
-	Facilitate scientific research by organising workshops, working paper series & courses
-	Allocate congress funds 
-	Promote and support faculty unit leaders in developing research networks with other universities
-	Encourage and assist faculty unit leaders in establishing research theme(s) for each unit
-	Internal recruitment and selection of PhD students
-	Publish memorandum on the scientific research policy of the faculty
-	Promote the acquisition of external funds for scientific research 
-	Establish a research climate in the faculty

Membership of various academic committees:
-	Member of the Scientific Research Committee (Wetenschapscommissie) of the Open University of the Netherlands, evaluating research proposals and designing research policy for the university
-	Chairman of the Scientific Research Committee of the Faculty of Management Sciences, evaluating research proposals
-	Member of the Research Committee of the Faculty of Management Sciences, evaluating research proposals
-	Chairman of the workgroup scientific research, designing research policy for the faculty
-	Convenor of the Academic Colloquium Committee of the Faculty of Management Sciences, in charge of organising monthly seminar series
-	Member of the Management Sciences Research Committee, designing research policy for the faculty and assess contributions to the Management Sciences Working Papers series

Participation in various workgroups:
-	Workgroup progress master theses and research skills
-	Workgroup mid-term review research 
-	Workgroup master thesis quality assurance 
-	Taskgroup educational processes
-	Workgroup preparation visitation

Teaching
For an overview see position as Assistant Professor

Budget responsibility: 2.250.000 euro.

profile_positions.description: Project manager of ‘Digital Interactive Marketing Education’ (Digitaal Interactief Marketing Onderwijs). The goal of the project was to develop e-learning materials in the field of marketing for the Open University of The Netherlands and the Hogeschool of Utrecht. Under my supervision a team of about 28 people (in various combinations) developed four digital marketing courses, worth of about 500 hours of study material. Budget responsibility: 450.000 euro.

profile_positions.description:
Dissertation: ‘Regional growth differentials – The impact of locally bounded knowledge spillovers’
- Subject area: technology-gap models, economic growth, regional development 
- Supervisors: Prof. Dr. L.L.G. Soete and Prof. Dr. B. Verspagen

Dissertation was published by Edward Elgar under the titel: "Knowledge spillovers and economic growth"
